comment.author: 55198937@N05
comment._content: The SS 'Tsinan' built by Scotts Greenock 1886, for the China Navigation Company, 2270 gross tons, length 315' , early life as Pacific, Australian, and Asian trader . In Russian hands from 1914 and served some time as a slave ship for Stalin's captives. Scrapped after 1950. [From clydesite].

comment.author: 31995064@N07
comment._content: A beautiful and fascinating boat, too bad about the stalinist era use

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] [http://www.flickr.com/photos/angeljim46] Thanks folks for the holiday investigating. Very interesting!. The book 'Stalin's Slave Ships: Kolyma, the Gulag Fleet, and the Role of the West' (Martin J. Bollinger) has a short history of TSINAN (p 99- 100). Seems there were two TSINAN's, the other was built in 1920 as RIPON and sold to the Soviet Union in 1938. The later ship was used to transport political prisoner Thomas Sgovio.
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
